help.association.description:: Item association question between two draggable lists.
help.association.description:duplicate_r: This will allow the possible responses to be reused infinite times. Responses will not disappear from the response container.
help.association.description:feedback_at: If Check Answer is enabled, this field determines how many times a user can click on the Check Answer button. 0 means unlimited.
help.association.description:group_possi: Categorise possible responses into different groups, with each group having its own heading.
help.association.description:instant_fee: Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question, which will provide the student with instant feedback on their response(s).
help.association.description:instructor_: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.
help.association.description:is_math: Enabling this option allows LaTeX or MathML to be rendered in the question. If you try to enter math while this option is disabled, the LaTeX/MathML will not render properly on screen.
help.association.description:math_render: Choose the rendering engine for math content within a question. Default rendering engine is MathJax with MathQuill for input areas. If you change this option to "mathquill", MathQuill will render all math content within a question.
help.association.description:metadata.ac: A multi-use field that is used to add acknowledgements (copyright, credits, thanks).
help.association.description:metadata.di: Used to display response feedback/rationale to the student.
Enter Distractor value for each response.
help.association.description:metadata.ru: Refers to a pre-created rubric in the Learnosity item bank.
help.association.description:metadata.sa: A sample answer that is stored for display/reference when teacher scoring.
help.association.description:possible_re: List of possible response values, grouped together under a category heading.
Array of strings values that need to be dragged to the actual response position.
A list of response options to be dragged by the student into the corresponding response positions.
help.association.description:shuffle_opt: Display the stimulus list options in a different order each time the question is rendered.
help.association.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.association.description:stimulus_li: A list of statements draggable responses should be matched with.
help.association.description:stimulus_re: Shows an alternate (e.g. abbreviated) question stimulus when in review mode.
help.association.description:ui_style.fo: Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).
help.association.description:ui_style.po: Defines the position of the possible responses container. The container can be positioned on the top, bottom, left or right of the question.
help.association.description:ui_style.sh: An icon to the left of each response option that indicates to the student that the item can be dragged.
help.association.description:ui_style.va: Numeration characters displayed to the left of the validation label. Only visible in review state.
help.association.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.
The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.

Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).
help.audio.description:instructor_stimul: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.
help.audio.description:is_math: Enabling this option allows LaTeX or MathML to be rendered in the question. If you try to enter math while this option is disabled, the LaTeX/MathML will not render properly on screen.
help.audio.description:math_renderer: When a question contains math, this setting allows you to select your preferred math renderer: MathJax or MathQuill.
help.audio.description:max_length: The length of audio, in seconds, allowed to be recorded by the student. Maximum value is 3600 (1 hour), default value is 600 (10 minutes).
help.audio.description:metadata.acknowle: A multi-use field that is used to add acknowledgements (copyright, credits, thanks).
help.audio.description:metadata.distract: Used to display response feedback/rationale to the student.
help.audio.description:metadata.rubric_r: Refers to a pre-created rubric in the Learnosity item bank.
help.audio.description:metadata.sample_a: A sample answer that is stored for display/reference when teacher scoring.
help.audio.description:overwrite_warning: A warning message will appear, informing the user that their recording will be replaced if they attempt to re-record.
help.audio.description:recording_cue: A beep is played to indicate the start of the recording.
help.audio.description:silence_stop_dura: Duration of audio silence, in seconds, that is allowed before recording is stopped. This value is set to 0 by default, which means the silence detection is turned off.
help.audio.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.audio.description:stimulus_review: Shows an alternate (e.g. abbreviated) question stimulus when in review mode.
help.audio.description:ui_style.download: A link to download the student's recorded audio file will appear in review state.
help.audio.description:ui_style.fontsize: Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).
help.audio.description:ui_style.pause: Allows the user to pause the recording in playback mode.
help.audio.description:ui_style.pause_re: When the pause button is enabled, it is visible to the student.
help.audio.description:ui_style.play: Allows the user to playback the recording.
help.audio.description:ui_style.play_bub: A bubble will appear on Play to show recording information (time, play/pause button, waveform, etc.) Only available in the Button UI.
help.audio.description:ui_style.progress: A visual indicator to the student, displaying how much time they have to record. In playback mode, it will indicate how long is left.
help.audio.description:ui_style.record_b: A bubble will appear on Record to show the recording information (time, record/pause button, etc.) Only available with the Button UI.
help.audio.description:ui_style.responsi: The audio recorder size is scaled responsively, based on the size of its container.
help.audio.description:ui_style.seek: The student will be able to change the play position by clicking on the Progress Bar. The Play button and Progress Bar must be enabled.
help.audio.description:ui_style.start_re: When the record button is enabled, it is visible to the student.
help.audio.description:ui_style.stop_rec: When the stop button is enabled, it is visible to the student.
help.audio.description:ui_style.timer: The length of the recording will be displayed to the student.
help.audio.description:ui_style.type: Interface style for the audio recorder. Options are: Block or Button.
help.audio.description:ui_style.volume_c: Volume control will be displayed to the user on playback. Play button must be enabled. Only available in Block UI.
help.audio.description:ui_style.volume_m: Volume meter will be displayed to the user on playback. Play button must be enabled. Only available in Block UI.
help.audio.description:ui_style.waveform: A wave UI will be displayed to the user on playback. The play button must be enabled.
help.audio.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
help.audio.description:validation.max_sc: The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
help.audio.description:validation.min_sc: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.audio.description:validation.unscor: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.audioplayer.description:: Embed an audio asset to be used as stimulus for your context. You can use your own audio or audio hosted on the Internet.
help.audioplayer.description:caption: Description of the audio being played
help.audioplayer.description:format:
Allows specifying the audio format instead of relying on the file extension on src.
If format is not defined and src does not have a file extension, the format is assumed to be "mp3".
help.audioplayer.description:heading: Heading of the audio player
help.audioplayer.description:img_height: Defines height property of the image
help.audioplayer.description:img_width: Defines width property of the image
help.audioplayer.description:metadata: Additional data for the audio player
help.audioplayer.description:metadata.tr: The transcript for the audio being played
help.audioplayer.description:no_controls: Defines whether the user can control the playback of the player
help.audioplayer.description:no_play_ico: Defines whether the player's play icon will be visible
help.audioplayer.description:playback_li: Number of play attempts the user has, with 0 being unlimited.
help.audioplayer.description:player: Specify the type of audio player between the options: block, button, minimal, bar.
help.audioplayer.description:src: Embed an audio clip as an additional feature to the current content. You can use your own audio or audio hosted on the Internet.
help.audioplayer.description:text: Text content of the audio player
help.audioplayer.description:title: Title text of the text audio player
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style: Object that defines the different UI styles of the audio player.
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.do: If true, a link to download the audio asset is displayed in the UI
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.pa: Defines whether the pause button is displayed in the UI
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.pl: Defines whether the play button is displayed in the UI
Defines whether playback bubble is displayed in the UI, only available for 'button' type
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.pr: Defines whether the progress bar is displayed in the UI
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.re: The component's size will be scaled responsively based on its container's size.
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.se: Defines whether the user can change the play position
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.ti: Defines whether the timer is displayed in the UI
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.vo: Defines whether the volume control is displayed in the UI
Defines whether the volume meter is displayed in the UI
help.audioplayer.description:ui_style.wa: Defines whether the waveform is displayed in the UI
help.audioplayer.description:waveform: URI of the waveform to display.

help.calculator.description:: Supply a calculator to assist users on mathematical calculations.
help.calculator.description:extended: Indicate whether the calculator should display extra keys, including CE, square root, and percentage.
help.calculator.description:mode: Mode of calculator to render. Values: basic, scientific
help.calculator.description:unit: Unit of angular measuring that calculator renders by default, it can be toggled via calculator UI. Values: radian, degree
help.chemistry.description:: The user can enter complex math notation.
help.chemistry.description:feedback_atte: If Check Answer is enabled, this field determines how many times a user can click on the Check Answer button. 0 means unlimited.
help.chemistry.description:handwriting_r: The set of characters that the handwriting keypad will be able to recognise. This feature is currently unavailable.
help.chemistry.description:horizontal_la: Enables a horizontal layout with ten columns and two rows.
help.chemistry.description:instant_feedb: Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question, which will provide the student with instant feedback on their response(s).

help.chemistry.description:numberPad: Create custom number pads on the student's keypad.
help.chemistry.description:response_cont: Used to configure the response boxes. Use Response Container (global) to make changes to all response boxes at once.
The ARIA label for the response container. The label will be "Response area" by default if no label is provided.
Configure attributes, such as Height and Width, for each response container individually.
The height of the response container. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "100em".
The width of the response container. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "100em".
help.chemistry.description:showHints: Disables hints, including keyboard shortcuts and group titles, shown on the keyboard's top left corner when hovering over a symbol group key.
help.chemistry.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
help.chemistry.description:stimulus_revi: Shows an alternate (e.g. abbreviated) question stimulus when in review mode.
help.chemistry.description:symbols: Choose from a range of symbol groups to be displayed on the keypad. Custom symbols can also be created for the keypad.
help.chemistry.description:symbols.label: Label to be shown on the top of the keyboard in the LaTeX format. Use \text{} wrapper for simple text data.
help.chemistry.description:symbols.title: Title will appear as alt text or on hover over.
help.chemistry.description:symbols.value: Enter symbols to appear on keyboard.
help.chemistry.description:template: A LaTeX only area where you can enter response boxes, numbers, formulae or symbols.
help.chemistry.description:text_blocks[*: Defines a list of custom text that will not be rendered as LaTeX. Useful for units of measurement, e.g. cm, m, mm.
help.chemistry.description:ui_style.font: Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).
help.chemistry.description:ui_style.keyb: When enabled, this will position the floating keyboard below the question when opened (below the last line of the response area). Otherwise this will appear below each line of the response area.
help.chemistry.description:ui_style.min_: Controls the minimum width of the response input area. Default units are "px" and will be appended if no units provided. For units other than "px", provide them in the field. E.g. "30em".
help.chemistry.description:ui_style.resp: Scales content in the LaTeX/Template Markup area. Options are: Boosted - 150% or Normal - 100%.
help.chemistry.description:ui_style.tran: Determines whether or not the response area is transparent.
help.chemistry.description:ui_style.type:
Keyboards types available. Options are:
  • Floating - draggable keypad, appears when the student click into the response box
  • Block - non-draggable keypad, always visible
  • Block-on-Focus - non-draggable keypad; appears when the student click into the response box
  • None - no keypad is displayed
help.chemistry.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
help.chemistry.description:validation.al: Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Add multiple objects to validate the response with. Every item inside the list must match the question response to be considered valid.
A plain text version of the correct answer, available in review state for screen reader users
Select one of the question scoring methods in the dropdown menu. Only available in Shading, Math, and Chemistry question types.
Extra options for the selected method.
Specifies the number of significant decimal places. Maximum value is 20.
Treat " a " and "a" in the student's response as the same.
Ignores the order of terms and factors. E.g. both x+1 and 1+x will be considered correct.
Inverts the response specified in validation. Any response will be correct except for the one set by the author.
Treat "ab" and "a   b" in the student's response as the same.
Enter the correct response for the question.

  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.
help.chemistry.description:validation.sc:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
help.chemistry.description:validation.un: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.chemistry.description:validation.va: The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).
Add multiple objects to validate the response with. Every item inside the list must match the question response to be considered valid.
A plain text version of the correct response, available in review state for screen reader users.
Select one of the question scoring methods in the dropdown menu. Only available in Shading, Math, and Chemistry question types.
Extra options for the selected method.
Specifies the number of significant decimal places. Maximum value is 20.
Treat " a " and "a" in the student's response as the same.
Ignores the order of terms and factors. E.g. both x+1 and 1+x will be considered correct.
Inverts the response specified in validation. Any response will be correct except for the one set by the author.
Treat "ab" and "a   b" in the student's response as the same.

help.chemistryessayV2.description:: Long essay questions which may include text formatting controls.
help.chemistryessayV2.description:charac:
There are 3 character maps available:
  • Standard alpha
  • Numerical (appears by default when Has Mathematical Formulas? is enabled)
  • Custom (insert special characters in the Characters to Display field)
help.chemistryessayV2.description:disabl: Sets whether urls, entered by the user should automatically become clickable-links.
help.chemistryessayV2.description:format:
An array containing strings of text formatting options to make available. Available options:
  • bold
  • italic
  • underline
  • unorderedList
  • orderedList
  • removeFormat
  • alignLeft
  • alignCenter
  • alignRight
  • alignJustify
  • superscript
  • subscript
  • indentIncrease
  • indentDecrease
  • textDirectionLtr
  • textDirectionRtl
  • insertHorizontalRule
  • table
  • charactermap
  • image
  • formulaEditor
  • undo
  • redo

Defines whether the word limit should be displayed in the toolbar or not. The options are:
  • Always On - Word Limit is always displayed.
  • On Limit - Word Limit will only be displayed when the limit is reached.
  • Off - Word Limit will not be displayed.

help.classification.description:max_resp: Limits the number of possible responses a cell can have. When set to 0 or blank, unlimited responses can be dragged into a cell.
help.classification.description:metadata: A multi-use field that is used to add acknowledgements (copyright, credits, thanks).
Used to display response feedback/rationale to the student.
Used to display individual response feedback/rationale to the student.
Refers to a pre-created rubric in the Learnosity item bank.
A sample answer that is stored for display/reference when teacher scoring.
help.classification.description:possible: List of possible response values, grouped together under a category heading.
Array of strings values that need to be dragged to the actual response position.
A list of response options to be dragged by the student into the corresponding response positions.
help.classification.description:shuffle_: Display the possible response drag and drop options in a different order each time the question is rendered.
help.classification.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
Shows an alternate (e.g. abbreviated) question stimulus when in review mode.
help.classification.description:ui_style: Number of columns in the classification table.
Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).
Defines the position of the possible responses container. The container can be positioned on the top, bottom, left or right of the question.
Number of rows in the classification table.
The minimum height of the row title column.
The width of the row title column.
An icon to the left of each response option that indicates to the student that the item can be dragged.
Numeration characters displayed to the left of the validation label. Only visible in review state.
help.classification.description:validati: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.
The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.

Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Cell - Each correct cell will be scored will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match Per Cell - Max Score - Each correct cell will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between cells.
  • Partial match Per Element - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match per Element V2 - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).

Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
Add multiple objects to validate the response with. Every item inside the list must match the question response to be considered valid.
A plain text version of the correct response, available in review state for screen reader users.
Select one of the question scoring methods in the dropdown menu. Only available in Shading, Math, and Chemistry question types.
Extra options for the selected method.

Treats the use of lowercase 'e' as Euler's number. Author selects this option to override the default interpretation as scientific notation and validates responses with lowercase 'e' as equivalent to Euler's number.
This option must be enabled when the students are expected to insert interval notation (non-matching bracket types, e.g. [1,3)).
Allows using different thousand and decimal separators in numbers greater than 1000.

Argument for the syntax rule used to specify syntax pattern. Must be entered as  ormat{..}. E.g. "
umber{3}" means any decimal with 3 decimal places, "\decimal{4}" means any decimal with 4 digits.

Enable this flag when using parenthesis grouping with the equivLiteral method. This flag forces equivLiteral away from its default state to recognise parenthesis and correctly support the commutative property of multiplication.
Used when comparing two constant equations when both sides of an equation have not been specified, such as {{response}} + {{response}} = {{response}}.
Specifies the number of significant decimal places. Maximum value is 20.

Select allowed factors depending on the type of expression. Options are:
  • integer
  • real number
  • complex number
Ignores the coefficient of 1 before an integer. E.g. 1x+2 and x+2 will be treated as equal.
Treat " a " and "a" in the student's response as the same.
Ignores the order of terms and factors. E.g. both x+1 and 1+x will be considered correct.
Ignores any LaTeX text entered in the response area. Authors do not need to include all text entered in the Template Markup area in the validation area.
Ignores trailing zeros after decimal separator, e.g. 1000 and 1000.000 will be treated as equal.
Inverts the response specified in validation. Any response will be correct except for the one set by the author.
Select a decimal separator. Options are: dot or comma.
Select a thousand separator. Options are: dot, comma or space.
Enabling this flag will treat all letters as variables and they will not be recognized as a unit of measurement.
Treat "ab" and "a   b" in the student's response as the same.

In this section, configure validation for the response boxes on the image - each accordion box represents one of the response boxes.
A plain text version of the correct response, available in review state for screen reader users.
Select one of the question scoring methods in the dropdown menu. Only available in Shading, Math, and Chemistry question types.
Extra options for the selected method.

Treats the use of lowercase 'e' as Euler's number. Author selects this option to override the default interpretation as scientific notation and validates responses with lowercase 'e' as equivalent to Euler's number.
This option must be enabled when the students are expected to insert interval notation (non-matching bracket types, e.g. [1,3)).
Allows using different thousand and decimal separators in numbers greater than 1000.

Argument for the syntax rule used to specify syntax pattern. Must be entered as  ormat{..}. E.g. "
umber{3}" means any decimal with 3 decimal places, "\decimal{4}" means any decimal with 4 digits.

Enable this flag when using parenthesis grouping with the equivLiteral method. This flag forces equivLiteral away from its default state to recognise parenthesis and correctly support the commutative property of multiplication.
Used when comparing two constant equations when both sides of an equation have not been specified, such as {{response}} + {{response}} = {{response}}.
Specifies the number of significant decimal places. Maximum value is 20.

Select allowed factors depending on the type of expression. Options are:
  • integer
  • real number
  • complex number
Ignores the coefficient of 1 before an integer. E.g. 1x+2 and x+2 will be treated as equal.
Treat " a " and "a" in the student's response as the same.
Ignores the order of terms and factors. E.g. both x+1 and 1+x will be considered correct.
Ignores any LaTeX text entered in the response area. Authors do not need to include all text entered in the Template Markup area in the validation area.
Ignores trailing zeros after decimal separator, e.g. 1000 and 1000.000 will be treated as equal.
Inverts the response specified in validation. Any response will be correct except for the one set by the author.
Select a decimal separator. Options are: dot or comma.
Select a thousand separator. Options are: dot, comma or space.
Enabling this flag will treat all letters as variables and they will not be recognized as a unit of measurement.
Treat "ab" and "a   b" in the student's response as the same.
Enter the correct response for the question.

  • Numerical (appears by default when Has Mathematical Formulas? is enabled)
  • Custom (insert special characters in the Characters to Display field)

help.clozetext.description:ignore_leadin: Determines whether the automatic marking will ignore leading and trailing spaces. E.g. 'a' and ' a ' will be treated as the same.

help.clozetext.description:validation.al: Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
help.clozetext.description:validation.au: Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.
help.clozetext.description:validation.ma: If true, the responses will be matched against all combinations of valid and alternate responses for the response position. Otherwise, responses will be scored from the valid responses, or one of the alternate responses, but never a combination of them.
The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
help.clozetext.description:validation.mi: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.clozetext.description:validation.pe: A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.
help.clozetext.description:validation.ro:
Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.
help.clozetext.description:validation.sc:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
help.clozetext.description:validation.un: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.clozetext.description:validation.va: The correct response for the question.

umber{3}" means any decimal with 3 decimal places, "\decimal{4}" means any decimal with 4 digits.

Used when comparing two constant equations when both sides of an equation have not been specified, such as {{response}} + {{response}} = {{response}}.

Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.

The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).

help.orderlist.description:validation.sc:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.

  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response entity will be awarded an individual score.

The validation method for the question. Options are:
  • byLocation - Use when the task is to highlight specific cells on the grid.
  • byCount - Use when the task is to select the correct amount of cells. Cell location does not matter.

The value will be different types according to the method:
'byLocation': value should be an array of form [y, x] that use 1-based indexing rather than 0-based, e.g. [1, 1] means the cell at first row, first column.
'byCount': value should be a number.

help.sortlist.description:validation: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.
help.sortlist.description:validation.all: Negative scores will be normalised to zero by default. Allowing negative scores, on the other hand, means that the score can drop below zero when penalties are applied.
help.sortlist.description:validation.alt: Add an alternate response if there is more than one correct overall solution to a question.
help.sortlist.description:validation.aut: Defines whether the question will be marked automatically, or must be marked manually.
help.sortlist.description:validation.max: The highest score that can be awarded for the response. Needs to be configured by development team.
help.sortlist.description:validation.min: Positive value indicating the minimum score if a student attempted the question.
help.sortlist.description:validation.pen: A value which indicates how many marks will be deducted for an incorrect response.
help.sortlist.description:validation.rou:
Defines whether score rounding should be applied. Options are:
  • None: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded to four decimal places, e.g. 2.6666
  • Floor: Overall question score will be divided between correct responses and rounded down to the nearest whole number.
Only works with Partial Match scoring.
help.sortlist.description:validation.sco:
The way in which marks are distributed for the question.
  • Exact Match - All parts of the question must be answered correctly to receive a mark.
  • Partial Match Per Response - Each correct response element will be awarded an individual score.
  • Partial Match - Each correct response element will be scored individually, and the overall question score will be divided between responses.
help.sortlist.description:validation.uns: When enabled, this option will remove all scoring from the question. This is useful for creating practice questions.
help.sortlist.description:validation.val: The correct response for the question.
Score awarded for the correct response(s).
help.tokenhighlight.description:: User can click/tap words/sentences to highlight
help.tokenhighlight.description:feedback: If Check Answer is enabled, this field determines how many times a user can click on the Check Answer button. 0 means unlimited.
help.tokenhighlight.description:instant_: Enables the Check Answer button underneath the question, which will provide the student with instant feedback on their response(s).
help.tokenhighlight.description:instruct: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.
help.tokenhighlight.description:is_math: Enabling this option allows LaTeX or MathML to be rendered in the question. If you try to enter math while this option is disabled, the LaTeX/MathML will not render properly on screen.
help.tokenhighlight.description:math_ren: When a question contains math, this setting allows you to select your preferred math renderer: MathJax or MathQuill.
help.tokenhighlight.description:max_sele: Defines how many tokens can be selected when giving an answer. 0 means an unlimited amount.
help.tokenhighlight.description:metadata: A multi-use field that is used to add acknowledgements (copyright, credits, thanks).
Used to display response feedback/rationale to the student.
Used for storing the distractor rationales that map to responses in the same order for use/rendering by the host environment.
Refers to a pre-created rubric in the Learnosity item bank.
A sample answer that is stored for display/reference when teacher scoring.
help.tokenhighlight.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.
Shows an alternate (e.g. abbreviated) question stimulus when in review mode.
help.tokenhighlight.description:template: The area where text is inserted, and clickable tokens are created. Select Edit Template to make changes in the passage of text, and Edit Tokens to tokenize words, sentences, or paragraphs. You can also create Custom Tokens here. Click on Clear, which removes any previous tokenization, and start highlighting desired tokens with your mouse cursor.
help.tokenhighlight.description:ui_style: Controls the size of the font for this question. Options are: "small"(11px), "normal"(14px), "large"(17px), "extra large"(20px) and "huge"(24px).
help.tokenhighlight.description:validati: In this section, configure the correct answer(s) for the question.

help.video.description:instructor_stimul: Provides additional details to Proctors/Instructors during assessments; never shown to students. Can be previewed in the Question Editor.

help.video.description:max_length: The length of video, in seconds, allowed to be recorded by the student. Maximum value and default value is 600 (10 minutes)
help.video.description:metadata.acknowle: A multi-use field that is used to add acknowledgements (copyright, credits, thanks).
help.video.description:metadata.distract: Used to display response feedback/rationale to the student.
help.video.description:metadata.rubric_r: Refers to a pre-created rubric in the Learnosity item bank.
help.video.description:metadata.sample_a: A sample answer that is stored for display/reference when teacher scoring.
help.video.description:overwrite_warning: A warning message will appear, informing the user that their recording will be replaced if they attempt to re-record.
help.video.description:stimulus: The question stimulus. This can include text, tables, images, resources and LaTeX entered via the Math Editor.

help.videoplayer.description:: Embed a video asset to be used as stimulus for your context. You can use your own video or video hosted on the Internet.
help.videoplayer.description:allow_retri: Specifies whether to allow retries when loading video.
help.videoplayer.description:brightcove-: The brightcove code object that is generated by Brightcove
help.videoplayer.description:caption: Description of the video being played
help.videoplayer.description:heading: Heading of the video
help.videoplayer.description:height: The height of the video player in pixels or percentage. IMPORTANT Responsive design with percentage height and width is not supported for Vimeo videos.
help.videoplayer.description:hide_captio: Defines whether closed caption should be hidden if available.
help.videoplayer.description:metadata: Additional data for the video player
help.videoplayer.description:metadata.tr: The transcript for the video being played
help.videoplayer.description:no-controls: Switch to Yes to remove the video controls from the player.
help.videoplayer.description:poster: A cover image for the video before it starts playing. For iOS devices, ensure you include a poster image as the video will not be preloaded to show the first frame.
help.videoplayer.description:src: A link to your hosted video. You can upload an MP4 file (H.264/MPEG-4 is the only supported video format, this is the most commonly used and supported video format).
help.videoplayer.description:text_altern: A link to your hosted video's caption file. You can upload an VTT file.
help.videoplayer.description:width: The width of the video player in pixels or percentage. IMPORTANT Responsive design with percentage height and width is not supported for Vimeo videos.
